title: Dietitian
company_info: SingHealth Polyclinics, a leader in family medicine, provides seamless, patient-centred and preventive healthcare that is affordable and accessible to all. SingHealth Polyclinics' network of 8 polyclinics provides primary healthcare services to the community. It plays an integral role in promoting a healthy lifestyle within the community and empowering families with the knowledge of common health issues, care and treatment options. SingHealth Polyclinics is a member of Singapore Health Services (SingHealth) - a public healthcare cluster which also manages two hospitals and five specialty centres.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
You will provide a holistic and evidenced based medical nutrition therapy for patients and caregivers in primary care setting. Your role is to:
Apply theoretical and professional knowledge in assessing and formulating appropriate nutritional plan and develop relevant patient education resources
Maintains up-to-date, accurate and clear documentation
Motivates and supports patients in treatment adherence and making dietary changes with the aim of supporting patients in achieving optimal health.
Contribute to the field of nutrition and dietetics by participating in research activities and quality improvement projects
Conduct public education and interprofessional training for staff, patients and community
Collaborate with multi-disciplinary healthcare teams and contribute to the organization’s efforts in providing quality patient care, delivering clinical education to patients and community
Job Requirement:
Degree in Dietetics
Minimum 1-2 years of relevant clinical experience in healthcare settings with Dietetic services
Registered dietitian at Singapore Nutrition & Dietetics Association (SNDA) or any recognized Dietitians Association preferred
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work independently at different polyclinics
Ability to communicate local languages/ dialects will be an advantage

company_info: Be-Better aspires to support people to improve themselves daily. Our practices surround health and lifestyle reform for a better future, to help you save time by staying away from medically inhibiting scenarios. Join us on a self-actualisation journey about your ability to change your life.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At BeBetter - Health Singapore, we believe that nutrition and wellness are at the heart of a healthy and fulfilling life. As a Nutritionist, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the way our community approaches nutrition, illness prevention, and overall well-being. You will be part of a team that is committed to making a positive impact on the lives of our community.
General Responsibilities
As a Nutritionist, your responsibility is to oversee and perform a comprehensive scope focusing on nutrition education, improvement of lifestyle and progressive reform of habits. You will be responsible for ensuring that the highest standards of nutrition support. It is essential to stay updated on national and global nutrition guidelines, as well as continuously reviewing technical nutrition knowledge and client management approach.
We are looking for someone who works well in a team, providing nutrition support for the elderly with their meal plan and progressively creating content for the local community.
Your passion for nutrition and wellness makes you a thought leader in the industry, building on your strong public speaking skills will allow you to engage and educate small and large audiences, increasing participation and garnering attention.
Job Requirements
To excel as a Nutritionist at BeBetter- Health Singapore, you should possess the following qualifications and skills:
Bachelor's degree in Dietetics, Nutrition, Food Science & Nutrition, or other relevant qualifications.
Minimum of 1 year of related experience in food service & personal nutrition, with experience in aged care nutrition being a plus.
Strong knowledge of personal health and guidelines for chronic disease prevention.
Registered nutritionist/dietitian (Preferred member of Singapore Nutrition and Dietetics Association SNDA).
Proficient in Mandarin (written & spoken)
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, Energy & Nutrient Composition (HPB), or other nutrient analysis software, as well as web-based software applications.
Travelling overseas may be required.
Excellent public speaking skills with the ability to plan and deliver audience-appropriate presentations to achieve desired outcomes.
Program Development & Implementation
Part of your role will require you to plan and conceptualize nutrition programs and dietary plans to meet personal and team Key Performance Indicators (KPIs). Your expertise will be invaluable in addressing and advising on nutritional concerns, issues, and inquiries regarding meal planning.
We value compliance with client, company, and government nutrition, allergen, and sustainability requirements. Your contribution to meal planning, menu vetting, and regular inspections will ensure that we meet and improve on these standards.
